newsitem.title: GERMANY: Air France plans Hahn cargo trucking hub.
newsitem.headline: Air France plans Hahn cargo trucking hub.

text.p: Air France said it will open a Germany air cargo road feeder service hub at Hahn Airport.
Air France Cargo Germany director Helmut Scherret told Reuters: "We have signed an agreement for a trucking hub at Hahn Airport."
But full details of the project would be released at a news conference next year, he stressed.
Scherret said on November 21 that the hub would be a cost-saving measure but declined to comment on reports the hub would handle 60,000 tonnes of freight a year.
Air France currently transports most of its ex-Germany air cargo by truck from Frankfurt Airport to Paris for onward air transport.

Hahn Airport is a former U.S. military airport in the state of Rhineland-Palatinate, west of Frankfurt, which has a 24-hour operations licence. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax +44 171 542 5017
